item.title: Meredith add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "Humanity I love you because when you're hard up you pawn your intelligence to buy a drink." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Meredith add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "Poetry is the synthesis of hyacinths and biscuits." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Meredith add a quote by carl sandburg
item.description: "The moon is friend for the lonesome to talk to." -- carl sandburg

item.title: Meredith add a quote by Allen Ginsberg
item.description: "My own experience is that a certain kind of genius among students is best brought out in bed." -- Allen Ginsberg

item.title: Meredith add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "The fact that I was a girl never damaged my ambitions to be a pope or an emperor. " -- Willa Cather

item.title: Meredith add a quote by Sarah Williams
item.description: "I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night." -- Sarah Williams

item.title: Meredith add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "Humor is emotional chaos remembered in tranquility." -- James Thurber

item.title: Meredith add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "I'm either going to be a writer or a bum." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Meredith add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Well, basically there are two sorts of opera," said Nanny, who also had the true witch's ability to be confidently expert on the basis of no experience whatsoever. "There's your heavy opera, where basically people sing foreign and it goes like "Oh oh oh, I am dyin', oh I am dyin', oh oh oh, that's what I'm doin'", and there's your light opera, where they sing in foreign and it basically goes "Beer! Beer! Beer! Beer! I like to drink lots of beer!", although sometimes they drink champagne instead. That's basically all of opera, reely." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Meredith add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "He'd heard that writers spent all day in their dressing gowns drinking champagne. This is, of course, absolutely true." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Meredith add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett
